From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]
German Wikipedia has an article on:
Krankheit
Wikipedia de

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German krancheit, krankeit. By surface analysis, krank +‎ -heit; compare Alemannic German Chranket, Luxembourgish Krankheet.

Eclipsed non-native Middle High German malāze (“sickness, disease”), ultimately from Latin.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ˈkʁaŋkˌhaɪ̯t]
  • Audio (Austria):(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: Krank‧heit

Noun

[edit]

Krankheit f (genitive Krankheit, plural Krankheiten)

  1. sickness, illness
  2. disease

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Krankheit [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Krankheit die Krankheiten
genitive einer der Krankheit der Krankheiten
dative einer der Krankheit den Krankheiten
accusative eine die Krankheit die Krankheiten

Antonyms

[edit]
  • Gesundheit

Plautdietsch

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

krank +‎ -heit

Noun

[edit]

Krankheit f (plural Krankheite)

  1. disease, illness, sickness, malady
